question: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Haleakala Observatory in Maui, Hawaii.)  Carefully hold a thumb over the sun atop Haleakala, & you won't see a white ring like you would at sea level--just pure blue; the sky is so clear, that there's hardly any of this--the dispersion of light by atmospheric particles
